title: Beam Reinforcement Layout with Image
problem: A rectangular reinforced concrete beam has dimensions 12 in × 24 in (b × h). The beam requires tension reinforcement of $A_s = 2.4$ in². Determine the number of #8 bars required and check the bar spacing. The clear cover is 1.5 in and stirrup diameter is 3/8 in.

problemImage.caption: Figure 1: Typical beam cross-section with reinforcement

required: Determine the number of #8 bars and check minimum spacing requirements.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Number of Bars Required
solution_steps.content:
Number of bars required:

$$n = \frac{A_s}{A_b} = \frac{2.4}{0.79} = 3.04$$

Use **4-#8 bars** ($A_s = 4 \times 0.79 = 3.16$ in²)

solution_steps.title: Check Bar Spacing
solution_steps.content:
Available width for bars:

$$b_{available} = b - 2(cover) - 2(d_{stirrup}) = 12 - 2(1.5) - 2(0.375) = 8.25 \text{ in}$$

Spacing between bars (for 4 bars in one layer):

$$s = \frac{b_{available} - n \times d_b}{n - 1} = \frac{8.25 - 4 \times 1.0}{3} = 1.42 \text{ in}$$

image.caption: Figure 2: Bar spacing layout in beam width

solution_steps.title: Check Minimum Spacing Requirements
solution_steps.content:
Per ACI 318-19 Section 25.2.1, minimum spacing:

$$s_{min} = \max(d_b, 1 \text{ in}, 1.33 \times d_{agg})$$

For typical $d_{agg} = 3/4$ in:
$$s_{min} = \max(1.0, 1.0, 1.0) = 1.0 \text{ in}$$

Actual spacing $s = 1.42$ in $> 1.0$ in ✓

final_answer: Use **4-#8 bars** in a single layer. The spacing of 1.42 in exceeds the minimum requirement of 1.0 in. The provided $A_s = 3.16$ in² exceeds the required $A_s = 2.4$ in².

finalImage.caption: Figure 3: Final beam cross-section with 4-#8 bars

title: Circular Column Design with Math Expressions
problem: A circular concrete column has a diameter of 24 inches and is reinforced with 8-#10 bars. The concrete strength is $f'_c = 5,000$ psi and steel yield strength is $f_y = 60,000$ psi. Calculate the nominal axial compressive strength. The column area is {PI*12^2} sq in and steel area is {8*1.27} sq in.

problemImage.caption: Figure 1: 24" diameter circular column with spiral reinforcement

required: Calculate the nominal axial compressive strength $P_n$.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Gross and Steel Areas
solution_steps.content:
Gross area:
$$A_g = \pi \times (12)^2 = {PI*144} \text{ in}^2$$

Steel area:
$$A_{st} = 8 \times 1.27 = {8*1.27} \text{ in}^2$$

Reinforcement ratio:
$$\rho_g = \frac{A_{st}}{A_g} = \frac{{8*1.27}}{{PI*144}} = {8*1.27/(PI*144):.4f}$$
